newsitem.title: UK: Microsoft plans big British plant - paper.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft plans big British plant - paper.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. Chairman Bill Gates plans to set up a multimillion-dollar electronics research campus -- the software giant's first outside the United States -- in Cambridge, England, the Daily Telegraph newspaper said Saturday.
It said the announcement is expected within weeks and would turn the British university town into a technological powerhouse to rival Silicon Valley.
The paper said Gates would separately make a major donation to Cambridge University to fund a new science building.
The Telegraph quoted British Foreign Secretary Robin Cook as expressing his delight at the move.

"This vote of confidence from the most successful exponent of computer software in the world proves that Britain is a global leader in this field and will act as a magnet for further inward investment," Cook said.
